bibl.title: Eros on the Nile. Translated from the Polish by Geoffrey L. PACKER.
bibl.note: Egyptian erotic culture from dynastic to Hellenistic Egypt [in part. in the light of terracottas]. - Introduction. - 1. Major Theological Systems. - 2. Osiris in Myth and Cult. - 3. Apis and Other Sacred Bulls. - 4. Religious Aspects of Royal Power. - 5. Religion and Magic in Daily Life. - 6. Sexual Life: Standards and Constraints. - Chronological Table. Bibliography. Index.
bibl.seg: MYŚLIWIEC Karol, Eros on the Nile. Translated from the Polish by Geoffrey L. PACKER.
Ithaca, New York, Cornell University Press, 2004, xvi-180 pp., ill. n/bl. et coul. ISBN 0-8014-4000-9. $28.95.

Egyptian erotic culture from dynastic to Hellenistic Egypt [in part. in the light of terracottas]. - Introduction. - 1. Major Theological Systems. - 2. Osiris in Myth and Cult. - 3. Apis and Other Sacred Bulls. - 4. Religious Aspects of Royal Power. - 5. Religion and Magic in Daily Life. - 6. Sexual Life: Standards and Constraints. - Chronological Table. Bibliography. Index.
C.R. par Mehmet-Ali Ataç, BMCRev < http://bmcr.brynmawr.edu/2004/2004-10-15.html >. - Maryline Parca, AJA 112 (2008) pp. 549-550.
